_intro.title: Introduction
_intro.description:
Application Security Engineers ensure software applications are designed, developed, and deployed securely. They identify vulnerabilities, perform code reviews, and implement security measures throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC).

Learn more from the following resources:

_roles.title: Key Roles & Responsibilities
_roles.description:
Application Security Engineers are responsible for:
- Conducting static and dynamic code analysis
- Performing penetration tests on applications
- Implementing secure coding practices
- Collaborating with developers to fix vulnerabilities

_learning.title: Learning Path
_learning.description:
**Foundational Skills:**
- Secure coding principles
- Web application architecture
- Common vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10)

**Advanced Skills:**
- Penetration testing tools (Burp Suite, OWASP ZAP)
- Secure SDLC implementation
- Cloud and API security

_career-growth.title: Career Growth
_career-growth.description: Application Security Engineers can advance to roles like Senior AppSec Engineer, Security Architect, or Security Consultant, focusing on securing enterprise software or cloud applications.
